caption:
This photograph captures a dramatic nighttime scene dominated by a wildfire amidst a forested area. The image is centered on a brightly blazing fire, its orange and yellow flames starkly set against the mostly dark surroundings. The flames are sharply reflected in what could be a body of water at the bottom of the image, doubling the visual impact of the fire.

Around the fire, several trees are visible; their silhouettes outlined against a dimly lit, smoky background that fades into shades of dark blue and black. The trees are unevenly spaced, with some branches hanging loose, suggesting that the forest could be dense and possibly untended or wild. The overall atmosphere is eerie and foreboding, amplified by the contrast between the fierce fire and the gloomy, obscured forest and sky in the background.

The composition of the photograph, focusing on the contrast of light and shadow, and the reflection in the water (if present), adds a poignant intensity to the scene, highlighting the destructive beauty of nature.
title: Burning slash on a clear-cut in the Olympic National Timberland, Washington. Near the Olympic National Park, Washington. From the Environmental Protection Agency's Project DOCUMERICA collection, "In Praise of Forests". For additional images see fiche #s 209, 210, 211, 212, and 213. ENTHEOS. April, 1973.
